user_error_text: I have the issue: Faulty microphone — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: Faulty microphone. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Hardware / Port Issues.
cause: Physical jack/cable damage, faulty microphone or speaker hardware.
step_1: Inspect headphone jack and cables for damage; try another cable.
step_2: Test speakers/headset on another device to verify hardware works.
step_3: For USB devices, try different USB ports and reinstall the device driver.
step_4: If connector is loose, clean port and reseat connector; consider repair if physically damaged.
step_5: Replace faulty hardware if tests confirm physical failure.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Faulty microphone - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: No audio output — microphone not recording properly.
symptoms: Symptoms: No audio output. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Audio Output Not Working.
cause: Missing or disabled audio device, corrupted driver, or faulty hardware.
step_1: Check the speaker icon in the taskbar; ensure not muted and correct output is selected.
step_2: Open Device Manager → Sound, video and game controllers → scan for hardware changes.
step_3: Uninstall and reinstall audio driver; restart PC to let Windows re-detect devices.
step_4: Try alternative output (headphones/external speakers) to isolate hardware.
step_5: Run Windows Playing Audio troubleshooter (Settings → Troubleshoot → Playing Audio).
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: No audio output - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Audio driver missing — microphone not recording properly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Audio driver missing. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Audio Driver & Device Manager Problems.
cause: Driver corruption, missing driver, or driver conflicts after update.
step_1: Open Device Manager, uninstall the audio driver and restart to let Windows reinstall it.
step_2: Download the latest audio driver from OEM website and install as administrator.
step_3: If update caused issues, roll back driver in Device Manager to previous version.
step_4: Check Event Viewer for driver-related errors and address specific error codes.
step_5: Use OEM audio utilities to run diagnostics or firmware updates for USB sound devices.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Audio driver missing - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Frequent disconnections — microphone not recording properly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Frequent disconnections. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Bluetooth Audio Problems.
cause: Bluetooth pairing issues, codec mismatch, or low battery in headset.
step_1: Ensure Bluetooth headset is paired and set as default audio device.
step_2: Remove/forget the device and pair it again; check battery level on headset.
step_3: Update Bluetooth drivers and ensure Bluetooth service is running.
step_4: Switch codec settings if available (AAC/aptX) or use SBC as fallback.
step_5: Test headset on another device to confirm it's not a headset issue.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Frequent disconnections - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Problem: Spatial Sound issues when using apps or calls.
symptoms: Symptoms: Spatial Sound issues. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Sound Settings & Configuration Errors.
cause: Incorrect device selection, muted channels, sample rate mismatch, or audio enhancements conflict.
step_1: Open Sound Settings and select the correct playback/recording device.
step_2: Set sample rate and bit depth to a supported value (e.g., 44.1kHz or 48kHz).
step_3: Disable audio enhancements that may cause distortion.
step_4: Run Sound troubleshooter and reset sound settings if necessary.
step_5: Ensure system volume and app volumes are not muted or very low.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Spatial Sound issues - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Windows Audio Service stopped — microphone not recording properly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Windows Audio Service stopped. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: OS Services & System Audio Failures.
cause: Windows audio services stopped, system file corruption, or interrupted updates.
step_1: Open Services.msc and ensure Windows Audio and Windows Audio Endpoint Builder services are running.
step_2: Run `sfc /scannow` and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to repair system files.
step_3: Uninstall recent audio-related Windows updates if audio broke after update.
step_4: Create a new Windows user account to rule out profile corruption affecting audio.
step_5: If unresolved, backup data and perform a system repair or in-place upgrade.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Windows Audio Service stopped - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Background noise or static — microphone not recording properly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Background noise or static. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Microphone Input Errors.
cause: Microphone disabled, wrong input selected, driver or app permission issue.
step_1: Ensure microphone is unmuted and selected as default input in Sound Settings.
step_2: Check app permissions: Settings → Privacy → Microphone → allow apps to use microphone.
step_3: Test mic in Voice Recorder; if not detected, reinstall mic drivers.
step_4: Try different USB port or headset on another PC to rule out hardware.
step_5: Adjust mic levels and disable enhancements in Device Properties → Levels/Enhancements.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Background noise or static - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Exclusive mode blocking audio' and I can't hear anything.
symptoms: Symptoms: Exclusive mode blocking audio. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: App & Software Audio Issues.
cause: App-specific settings, wrong device selection, or exclusive mode causing routing issues.
step_1: Open the app's audio settings and ensure correct output/input device is selected.
step_2: Check Windows Volume Mixer to ensure the app is not muted or set to low volume.
step_3: Disable exclusive mode in Device Properties → Advanced to allow multiple apps to use audio.
step_4: Restart the app and test with another application to determine if app-specific.
step_5: Reinstall the app if settings are corrupted or reset app preferences.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.

user_error_text: I have the issue: No sound in specific app — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: No sound in specific app. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: App & Software Audio Issues.
cause: App-specific settings, wrong device selection, or exclusive mode causing routing issues.
step_1: Open the app's audio settings and ensure correct output/input device is selected.

user_error_text: Sample rate mismatch — microphone not recording properly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Sample rate mismatch. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Sound Settings & Configuration Errors.
cause: Incorrect device selection, muted channels, sample rate mismatch, or audio enhancements conflict.
step_1: Open Sound Settings and select the correct playback/recording device.
step_2: Set sample rate and bit depth to a supported value (e.g., 44.1kHz or 48kHz).
step_3: Disable audio enhancements that may cause distortion.
step_4: Run Sound troubleshooter and reset sound settings if necessary.
step_5: Ensure system volume and app volumes are not muted or very low.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Sample rate mismatch - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

cause: Incorrect device selection, muted channels, sample rate mismatch, or audio enhancements conflict.

user_error_text: I have the issue: Audio driver missing — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: Audio driver missing. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Audio Driver & Device Manager Problems.
cause: Driver corruption, missing driver, or driver conflicts after update.
step_1: Open Device Manager, uninstall the audio driver and restart to let Windows reinstall it.
step_2: Download the latest audio driver from OEM website and install as administrator.
step_3: If update caused issues, roll back driver in Device Manager to previous version.
step_4: Check Event Viewer for driver-related errors and address specific error codes.
step_5: Use OEM audio utilities to run diagnostics or firmware updates for USB sound devices.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Audio driver missing - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

error_name: Headphones plugged in but no sound
user_error_text: After update I see: Headphones plugged in but no sound. No sound plays.
symptoms: Symptoms: Headphones plugged in but no sound. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Audio Output Not Working.
cause: Missing or disabled audio device, corrupted driver, or faulty hardware.
step_1: Check the speaker icon in the taskbar; ensure not muted and correct output is selected.
step_2: Open Device Manager → Sound, video and game controllers → scan for hardware changes.
step_3: Uninstall and reinstall audio driver; restart PC to let Windows re-detect devices.
step_4: Try alternative output (headphones/external speakers) to isolate hardware.
step_5: Run Windows Playing Audio troubleshooter (Settings → Troubleshoot → Playing Audio).
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Headphones plugged in but no sound - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Problem: Pairing fails intermittently when using apps or calls.
symptoms: Symptoms: Pairing fails intermittently. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Bluetooth Audio Problems.
cause: Bluetooth pairing issues, codec mismatch, or low battery in headset.
step_1: Ensure Bluetooth headset is paired and set as default audio device.
step_2: Remove/forget the device and pair it again; check battery level on headset.
step_3: Update Bluetooth drivers and ensure Bluetooth service is running.
step_4: Switch codec settings if available (AAC/aptX) or use SBC as fallback.
step_5: Test headset on another device to confirm it's not a headset issue.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Pairing fails intermittently - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: After update I see: Mic not detected. No sound plays.
symptoms: Symptoms: Mic not detected. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Microphone Input Errors.
cause: Microphone disabled, wrong input selected, driver or app permission issue.
step_1: Ensure microphone is unmuted and selected as default input in Sound Settings.
step_2: Check app permissions: Settings → Privacy → Microphone → allow apps to use microphone.
step_3: Test mic in Voice Recorder; if not detected, reinstall mic drivers.
step_4: Try different USB port or headset on another PC to rule out hardware.
step_5: Adjust mic levels and disable enhancements in Device Properties → Levels/Enhancements.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.

user_error_text: After update I see: Audio endpoint builder failed. No sound plays.
symptoms: Symptoms: Audio endpoint builder failed. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: OS Services & System Audio Failures.
cause: Windows audio services stopped, system file corruption, or interrupted updates.
step_1: Open Services.msc and ensure Windows Audio and Windows Audio Endpoint Builder services are running.
step_2: Run `sfc /scannow` and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to repair system files.
step_3: Uninstall recent audio-related Windows updates if audio broke after update.
step_4: Create a new Windows user account to rule out profile corruption affecting audio.
step_5: If unresolved, backup data and perform a system repair or in-place upgrade.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Audio endpoint builder failed - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'USB audio device not detected' and I can't hear anything.
symptoms: Symptoms: USB audio device not detected. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Hardware / Port Issues.
cause: Physical jack/cable damage, faulty microphone or speaker hardware.
step_1: Inspect headphone jack and cables for damage; try another cable.
step_2: Test speakers/headset on another device to verify hardware works.
step_3: For USB devices, try different USB ports and reinstall the device driver.
step_4: If connector is loose, clean port and reseat connector; consider repair if physically damaged.
step_5: Replace faulty hardware if tests confirm physical failure.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: USB audio device not detected - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Speakers not working' and I can't hear anything.
symptoms: Symptoms: Speakers not working. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Audio Output Not Working.
cause: Missing or disabled audio device, corrupted driver, or faulty hardware.
step_1: Check the speaker icon in the taskbar; ensure not muted and correct output is selected.
step_2: Open Device Manager → Sound, video and game controllers → scan for hardware changes.
step_3: Uninstall and reinstall audio driver; restart PC to let Windows re-detect devices.
step_4: Try alternative output (headphones/external speakers) to isolate hardware.
step_5: Run Windows Playing Audio troubleshooter (Settings → Troubleshoot → Playing Audio).
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Speakers not working - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Problem: Speakers not working when using apps or calls.
symptoms: Symptoms: Speakers not working. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Audio Output Not Working.
cause: Missing or disabled audio device, corrupted driver, or faulty hardware.
step_1: Check the speaker icon in the taskbar; ensure not muted and correct output is selected.
step_2: Open Device Manager → Sound, video and game controllers → scan for hardware changes.

step_4: Try alternative output (headphones/external speakers) to isolate hardware.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Code 10 – Device cannot start' and I can't hear anything.
symptoms: Symptoms: Code 10 – Device cannot start. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Audio Driver & Device Manager Problems.
cause: Driver corruption, missing driver, or driver conflicts after update.
step_1: Open Device Manager, uninstall the audio driver and restart to let Windows reinstall it.
step_2: Download the latest audio driver from OEM website and install as administrator.
step_3: If update caused issues, roll back driver in Device Manager to previous version.
step_4: Check Event Viewer for driver-related errors and address specific error codes.
step_5: Use OEM audio utilities to run diagnostics or firmware updates for USB sound devices.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Code 10 – Device cannot start - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

cause: Driver corruption, missing driver, or driver conflicts after update.
step_1: Open Device Manager, uninstall the audio driver and restart to let Windows reinstall it.

user_error_text: I have the issue: Audio enhancements causing distortion — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: Audio enhancements causing distortion. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Sound Settings & Configuration Errors.
cause: Incorrect device selection, muted channels, sample rate mismatch, or audio enhancements conflict.
step_1: Open Sound Settings and select the correct playback/recording device.
step_2: Set sample rate and bit depth to a supported value (e.g., 44.1kHz or 48kHz).
step_3: Disable audio enhancements that may cause distortion.
step_4: Run Sound troubleshooter and reset sound settings if necessary.
step_5: Ensure system volume and app volumes are not muted or very low.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Audio enhancements causing distortion - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Audio service not responding' and I can't hear anything.
symptoms: Symptoms: Audio service not responding. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: OS Services & System Audio Failures.
cause: Windows audio services stopped, system file corruption, or interrupted updates.
step_1: Open Services.msc and ensure Windows Audio and Windows Audio Endpoint Builder services are running.
step_2: Run `sfc /scannow` and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to repair system files.
step_3: Uninstall recent audio-related Windows updates if audio broke after update.
step_4: Create a new Windows user account to rule out profile corruption affecting audio.
step_5: If unresolved, backup data and perform a system repair or in-place upgrade.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Audio service not responding - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: After update I see: Exclusive mode blocking audio. No sound plays.
symptoms: Symptoms: Exclusive mode blocking audio. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: App & Software Audio Issues.
cause: App-specific settings, wrong device selection, or exclusive mode causing routing issues.
step_1: Open the app's audio settings and ensure correct output/input device is selected.
step_2: Check Windows Volume Mixer to ensure the app is not muted or set to low volume.
step_3: Disable exclusive mode in Device Properties → Advanced to allow multiple apps to use audio.
step_4: Restart the app and test with another application to determine if app-specific.
step_5: Reinstall the app if settings are corrupted or reset app preferences.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Exclusive mode blocking audio - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: After update I see: Mic volume too low. No sound plays.
symptoms: Symptoms: Mic volume too low. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Microphone Input Errors.
cause: Microphone disabled, wrong input selected, driver or app permission issue.
step_1: Ensure microphone is unmuted and selected as default input in Sound Settings.
step_2: Check app permissions: Settings → Privacy → Microphone → allow apps to use microphone.
step_3: Test mic in Voice Recorder; if not detected, reinstall mic drivers.
step_4: Try different USB port or headset on another PC to rule out hardware.
step_5: Adjust mic levels and disable enhancements in Device Properties → Levels/Enhancements.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Mic volume too low - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

error_name: Bluetooth headphones connected but no sound
user_error_text: After update I see: Bluetooth headphones connected but no sound. No sound plays.
symptoms: Symptoms: Bluetooth headphones connected but no sound. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Bluetooth Audio Problems.
cause: Bluetooth pairing issues, codec mismatch, or low battery in headset.
step_1: Ensure Bluetooth headset is paired and set as default audio device.
step_2: Remove/forget the device and pair it again; check battery level on headset.
step_3: Update Bluetooth drivers and ensure Bluetooth service is running.
step_4: Switch codec settings if available (AAC/aptX) or use SBC as fallback.
step_5: Test headset on another device to confirm it's not a headset issue.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Bluetooth headphones connected but no sound - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

step_1: Ensure Bluetooth headset is paired and set as default audio device.
step_2: Remove/forget the device and pair it again; check battery level on headset.
step_3: Update Bluetooth drivers and ensure Bluetooth service is running.
step_4: Switch codec settings if available (AAC/aptX) or use SBC as fallback.
step_5: Test headset on another device to confirm it's not a headset issue.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Bluetooth headphones connected but no sound - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

error_name: Mic works in one app but not another
user_error_text: After update I see: Mic works in one app but not another. No sound plays.
symptoms: Symptoms: Mic works in one app but not another. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Microphone Input Errors.
cause: Microphone disabled, wrong input selected, driver or app permission issue.
step_1: Ensure microphone is unmuted and selected as default input in Sound Settings.
step_2: Check app permissions: Settings → Privacy → Microphone → allow apps to use microphone.
step_3: Test mic in Voice Recorder; if not detected, reinstall mic drivers.
step_4: Try different USB port or headset on another PC to rule out hardware.
step_5: Adjust mic levels and disable enhancements in Device Properties → Levels/Enhancements.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Mic works in one app but not another - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: After update I see: Pairing fails intermittently. No sound plays.
symptoms: Symptoms: Pairing fails intermittently. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Bluetooth Audio Problems.
cause: Bluetooth pairing issues, codec mismatch, or low battery in headset.
step_1: Ensure Bluetooth headset is paired and set as default audio device.
step_2: Remove/forget the device and pair it again; check battery level on headset.
step_3: Update Bluetooth drivers and ensure Bluetooth service is running.
step_4: Switch codec settings if available (AAC/aptX) or use SBC as fallback.
step_5: Test headset on another device to confirm it's not a headset issue.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Pairing fails intermittently - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

error_name: Headphones plugged in but no sound
user_error_text: After update I see: Headphones plugged in but no sound. No sound plays.
symptoms: Symptoms: Headphones plugged in but no sound. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Audio Output Not Working.
cause: Missing or disabled audio device, corrupted driver, or faulty hardware.
step_1: Check the speaker icon in the taskbar; ensure not muted and correct output is selected.
step_2: Open Device Manager → Sound, video and game controllers → scan for hardware changes.
step_3: Uninstall and reinstall audio driver; restart PC to let Windows re-detect devices.
step_4: Try alternative output (headphones/external speakers) to isolate hardware.
step_5: Run Windows Playing Audio troubleshooter (Settings → Troubleshoot → Playing Audio).
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Headphones plugged in but no sound - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Audio driver missing — microphone not recording properly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Audio driver missing. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Audio Driver & Device Manager Problems.
cause: Driver corruption, missing driver, or driver conflicts after update.
step_1: Open Device Manager, uninstall the audio driver and restart to let Windows reinstall it.
step_2: Download the latest audio driver from OEM website and install as administrator.
step_3: If update caused issues, roll back driver in Device Manager to previous version.
step_4: Check Event Viewer for driver-related errors and address specific error codes.
step_5: Use OEM audio utilities to run diagnostics or firmware updates for USB sound devices.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Audio driver missing - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Mic not detected' and I can't hear anything.
symptoms: Symptoms: Mic not detected. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Microphone Input Errors.
cause: Microphone disabled, wrong input selected, driver or app permission issue.
step_1: Ensure microphone is unmuted and selected as default input in Sound Settings.
step_2: Check app permissions: Settings → Privacy → Microphone → allow apps to use microphone.
step_3: Test mic in Voice Recorder; if not detected, reinstall mic drivers.
step_4: Try different USB port or headset on another PC to rule out hardware.
step_5: Adjust mic levels and disable enhancements in Device Properties → Levels/Enhancements.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Mic not detected - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: After update I see: Muted system volume. No sound plays.
symptoms: Symptoms: Muted system volume. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Sound Settings & Configuration Errors.
cause: Incorrect device selection, muted channels, sample rate mismatch, or audio enhancements conflict.
step_1: Open Sound Settings and select the correct playback/recording device.
step_2: Set sample rate and bit depth to a supported value (e.g., 44.1kHz or 48kHz).
step_3: Disable audio enhancements that may cause distortion.
step_4: Run Sound troubleshooter and reset sound settings if necessary.
step_5: Ensure system volume and app volumes are not muted or very low.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Muted system volume - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: I have the issue: Corrupted audio system files — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: Corrupted audio system files. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: OS Services & System Audio Failures.
cause: Windows audio services stopped, system file corruption, or interrupted updates.
step_1: Open Services.msc and ensure Windows Audio and Windows Audio Endpoint Builder services are running.
step_2: Run `sfc /scannow` and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to repair system files.
step_3: Uninstall recent audio-related Windows updates if audio broke after update.
step_4: Create a new Windows user account to rule out profile corruption affecting audio.
step_5: If unresolved, backup data and perform a system repair or in-place upgrade.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Corrupted audio system files - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: USB audio device not detected — microphone not recording properly.
symptoms: Symptoms: USB audio device not detected. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Hardware / Port Issues.
cause: Physical jack/cable damage, faulty microphone or speaker hardware.
step_1: Inspect headphone jack and cables for damage; try another cable.
step_2: Test speakers/headset on another device to verify hardware works.
step_3: For USB devices, try different USB ports and reinstall the device driver.
step_4: If connector is loose, clean port and reseat connector; consider repair if physically damaged.
step_5: Replace faulty hardware if tests confirm physical failure.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: USB audio device not detected - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

step_1: Check the speaker icon in the taskbar; ensure not muted and correct output is selected.
step_2: Open Device Manager → Sound, video and game controllers → scan for hardware changes.
step_3: Uninstall and reinstall audio driver; restart PC to let Windows re-detect devices.

user_error_text: Problem: App muted in volume mixer when using apps or calls.
symptoms: Symptoms: App muted in volume mixer. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: App & Software Audio Issues.
cause: App-specific settings, wrong device selection, or exclusive mode causing routing issues.
step_1: Open the app's audio settings and ensure correct output/input device is selected.
step_2: Check Windows Volume Mixer to ensure the app is not muted or set to low volume.
step_3: Disable exclusive mode in Device Properties → Advanced to allow multiple apps to use audio.
step_4: Restart the app and test with another application to determine if app-specific.
step_5: Reinstall the app if settings are corrupted or reset app preferences.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: App muted in volume mixer - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

step_5: Adjust mic levels and disable enhancements in Device Properties → Levels/Enhancements.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Mic not working - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: After update I see: Broken headphone jack. No sound plays.
symptoms: Symptoms: Broken headphone jack. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Hardware / Port Issues.
cause: Physical jack/cable damage, faulty microphone or speaker hardware.
step_1: Inspect headphone jack and cables for damage; try another cable.
step_2: Test speakers/headset on another device to verify hardware works.
step_3: For USB devices, try different USB ports and reinstall the device driver.
step_4: If connector is loose, clean port and reseat connector; consider repair if physically damaged.
step_5: Replace faulty hardware if tests confirm physical failure.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Broken headphone jack - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: I have the issue: Corrupted audio system files — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: Corrupted audio system files. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: OS Services & System Audio Failures.
cause: Windows audio services stopped, system file corruption, or interrupted updates.
step_1: Open Services.msc and ensure Windows Audio and Windows Audio Endpoint Builder services are running.
step_2: Run `sfc /scannow` and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to repair system files.
step_3: Uninstall recent audio-related Windows updates if audio broke after update.
step_4: Create a new Windows user account to rule out profile corruption affecting audio.
step_5: If unresolved, backup data and perform a system repair or in-place upgrade.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Corrupted audio system files - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Pairing fails intermittently' and I can't hear anything.
symptoms: Symptoms: Pairing fails intermittently. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Bluetooth Audio Problems.
cause: Bluetooth pairing issues, codec mismatch, or low battery in headset.
step_1: Ensure Bluetooth headset is paired and set as default audio device.
step_2: Remove/forget the device and pair it again; check battery level on headset.
step_3: Update Bluetooth drivers and ensure Bluetooth service is running.
step_4: Switch codec settings if available (AAC/aptX) or use SBC as fallback.
step_5: Test headset on another device to confirm it's not a headset issue.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Pairing fails intermittently - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

symptoms: Symptoms: Wrong playback device. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Sound Settings & Configuration Errors.
cause: Incorrect device selection, muted channels, sample rate mismatch, or audio enhancements conflict.
step_1: Open Sound Settings and select the correct playback/recording device.
step_2: Set sample rate and bit depth to a supported value (e.g., 44.1kHz or 48kHz).
step_3: Disable audio enhancements that may cause distortion.
step_4: Run Sound troubleshooter and reset sound settings if necessary.
step_5: Ensure system volume and app volumes are not muted or very low.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.

user_error_text: I have the issue: No sound in specific app — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: No sound in specific app. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: App & Software Audio Issues.
cause: App-specific settings, wrong device selection, or exclusive mode causing routing issues.
step_1: Open the app's audio settings and ensure correct output/input device is selected.
step_2: Check Windows Volume Mixer to ensure the app is not muted or set to low volume.
step_3: Disable exclusive mode in Device Properties → Advanced to allow multiple apps to use audio.
step_4: Restart the app and test with another application to determine if app-specific.
step_5: Reinstall the app if settings are corrupted or reset app preferences.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: No sound in specific app - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Problem: Speakers not working when using apps or calls.
symptoms: Symptoms: Speakers not working. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Audio Output Not Working.
cause: Missing or disabled audio device, corrupted driver, or faulty hardware.
step_1: Check the speaker icon in the taskbar; ensure not muted and correct output is selected.
step_2: Open Device Manager → Sound, video and game controllers → scan for hardware changes.
step_3: Uninstall and reinstall audio driver; restart PC to let Windows re-detect devices.
step_4: Try alternative output (headphones/external speakers) to isolate hardware.
step_5: Run Windows Playing Audio troubleshooter (Settings → Troubleshoot → Playing Audio).
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Speakers not working - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: I have the issue: Mic not working — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: Mic not working. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Microphone Input Errors.
cause: Microphone disabled, wrong input selected, driver or app permission issue.
step_1: Ensure microphone is unmuted and selected as default input in Sound Settings.
step_2: Check app permissions: Settings → Privacy → Microphone → allow apps to use microphone.
step_3: Test mic in Voice Recorder; if not detected, reinstall mic drivers.
step_4: Try different USB port or headset on another PC to rule out hardware.
step_5: Adjust mic levels and disable enhancements in Device Properties → Levels/Enhancements.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Mic not working - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: After update I see: Driver rollback error. No sound plays.
symptoms: Symptoms: Driver rollback error. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Audio Driver & Device Manager Problems.
cause: Driver corruption, missing driver, or driver conflicts after update.
step_1: Open Device Manager, uninstall the audio driver and restart to let Windows reinstall it.
step_2: Download the latest audio driver from OEM website and install as administrator.
step_3: If update caused issues, roll back driver in Device Manager to previous version.
step_4: Check Event Viewer for driver-related errors and address specific error codes.
step_5: Use OEM audio utilities to run diagnostics or firmware updates for USB sound devices.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.

log_snippet: Spatial Sound issues - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Problem: Mic not working when using apps or calls.
symptoms: Symptoms: Mic not working. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Microphone Input Errors.
cause: Microphone disabled, wrong input selected, driver or app permission issue.
step_1: Ensure microphone is unmuted and selected as default input in Sound Settings.
step_2: Check app permissions: Settings → Privacy → Microphone → allow apps to use microphone.
step_3: Test mic in Voice Recorder; if not detected, reinstall mic drivers.
step_4: Try different USB port or headset on another PC to rule out hardware.
step_5: Adjust mic levels and disable enhancements in Device Properties → Levels/Enhancements.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Mic not working - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Exclusive mode blocking audio — microphone not recording properly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Exclusive mode blocking audio. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: App & Software Audio Issues.
cause: App-specific settings, wrong device selection, or exclusive mode causing routing issues.
step_1: Open the app's audio settings and ensure correct output/input device is selected.
step_2: Check Windows Volume Mixer to ensure the app is not muted or set to low volume.
step_3: Disable exclusive mode in Device Properties → Advanced to allow multiple apps to use audio.
step_4: Restart the app and test with another application to determine if app-specific.
step_5: Reinstall the app if settings are corrupted or reset app preferences.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Exclusive mode blocking audio - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Problem: Windows Audio Service stopped when using apps or calls.
symptoms: Symptoms: Windows Audio Service stopped. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: OS Services & System Audio Failures.
cause: Windows audio services stopped, system file corruption, or interrupted updates.
step_1: Open Services.msc and ensure Windows Audio and Windows Audio Endpoint Builder services are running.
step_2: Run `sfc /scannow` and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to repair system files.
step_3: Uninstall recent audio-related Windows updates if audio broke after update.
step_4: Create a new Windows user account to rule out profile corruption affecting audio.
step_5: If unresolved, backup data and perform a system repair or in-place upgrade.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Windows Audio Service stopped - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: After update I see: Background noise or static. No sound plays.
symptoms: Symptoms: Background noise or static. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Microphone Input Errors.
cause: Microphone disabled, wrong input selected, driver or app permission issue.
step_1: Ensure microphone is unmuted and selected as default input in Sound Settings.
step_2: Check app permissions: Settings → Privacy → Microphone → allow apps to use microphone.
step_3: Test mic in Voice Recorder; if not detected, reinstall mic drivers.
step_4: Try different USB port or headset on another PC to rule out hardware.
step_5: Adjust mic levels and disable enhancements in Device Properties → Levels/Enhancements.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Background noise or static - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Faulty microphone — microphone not recording properly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Faulty microphone. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Hardware / Port Issues.
cause: Physical jack/cable damage, faulty microphone or speaker hardware.
step_1: Inspect headphone jack and cables for damage; try another cable.
step_2: Test speakers/headset on another device to verify hardware works.
step_3: For USB devices, try different USB ports and reinstall the device driver.
step_4: If connector is loose, clean port and reseat connector; consider repair if physically damaged.
step_5: Replace faulty hardware if tests confirm physical failure.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Faulty microphone - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Audio driver missing' and I can't hear anything.
symptoms: Symptoms: Audio driver missing. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Audio Driver & Device Manager Problems.
cause: Driver corruption, missing driver, or driver conflicts after update.
step_1: Open Device Manager, uninstall the audio driver and restart to let Windows reinstall it.
step_2: Download the latest audio driver from OEM website and install as administrator.
step_3: If update caused issues, roll back driver in Device Manager to previous version.
step_4: Check Event Viewer for driver-related errors and address specific error codes.
step_5: Use OEM audio utilities to run diagnostics or firmware updates for USB sound devices.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Audio driver missing - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: I have the issue: Audio enhancements causing distortion — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: Audio enhancements causing distortion. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Sound Settings & Configuration Errors.
cause: Incorrect device selection, muted channels, sample rate mismatch, or audio enhancements conflict.
step_1: Open Sound Settings and select the correct playback/recording device.
step_2: Set sample rate and bit depth to a supported value (e.g., 44.1kHz or 48kHz).
step_3: Disable audio enhancements that may cause distortion.
step_4: Run Sound troubleshooter and reset sound settings if necessary.
step_5: Ensure system volume and app volumes are not muted or very low.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Audio enhancements causing distortion - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Low-quality audio codec selected — microphone not recording properly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Low-quality audio codec selected. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Bluetooth Audio Problems.
cause: Bluetooth pairing issues, codec mismatch, or low battery in headset.
step_1: Ensure Bluetooth headset is paired and set as default audio device.
step_2: Remove/forget the device and pair it again; check battery level on headset.
step_3: Update Bluetooth drivers and ensure Bluetooth service is running.
step_4: Switch codec settings if available (AAC/aptX) or use SBC as fallback.
step_5: Test headset on another device to confirm it's not a headset issue.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Low-quality audio codec selected - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

step_5: Test headset on another device to confirm it's not a headset issue.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.

user_error_text: Audio service not responding — microphone not recording properly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Audio service not responding. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: OS Services & System Audio Failures.
cause: Windows audio services stopped, system file corruption, or interrupted updates.
step_1: Open Services.msc and ensure Windows Audio and Windows Audio Endpoint Builder services are running.
step_2: Run `sfc /scannow` and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to repair system files.
step_3: Uninstall recent audio-related Windows updates if audio broke after update.
step_4: Create a new Windows user account to rule out profile corruption affecting audio.
step_5: If unresolved, backup data and perform a system repair or in-place upgrade.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Audio service not responding - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'USB audio device not detected' and I can't hear anything.
symptoms: Symptoms: USB audio device not detected. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Hardware / Port Issues.
cause: Physical jack/cable damage, faulty microphone or speaker hardware.
step_1: Inspect headphone jack and cables for damage; try another cable.
step_2: Test speakers/headset on another device to verify hardware works.
step_3: For USB devices, try different USB ports and reinstall the device driver.
step_4: If connector is loose, clean port and reseat connector; consider repair if physically damaged.
step_5: Replace faulty hardware if tests confirm physical failure.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: USB audio device not detected - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: After update I see: No sound in specific app. No sound plays.
symptoms: Symptoms: No sound in specific app. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: App & Software Audio Issues.
cause: App-specific settings, wrong device selection, or exclusive mode causing routing issues.
step_1: Open the app's audio settings and ensure correct output/input device is selected.
step_2: Check Windows Volume Mixer to ensure the app is not muted or set to low volume.
step_3: Disable exclusive mode in Device Properties → Advanced to allow multiple apps to use audio.
step_4: Restart the app and test with another application to determine if app-specific.
step_5: Reinstall the app if settings are corrupted or reset app preferences.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: No sound in specific app - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Code 10 – Device cannot start — microphone not recording properly.

cause: Driver corruption, missing driver, or driver conflicts after update.

cause: Missing or disabled audio device, corrupted driver, or faulty hardware.

user_error_text: Mic not working — microphone not recording properly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Mic not working. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Microphone Input Errors.
cause: Microphone disabled, wrong input selected, driver or app permission issue.
step_1: Ensure microphone is unmuted and selected as default input in Sound Settings.

step_4: Try different USB port or headset on another PC to rule out hardware.
step_5: Adjust mic levels and disable enhancements in Device Properties → Levels/Enhancements.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.

error_name: Device Manager warning on sound drivers
user_error_text: Device Manager warning on sound drivers — microphone not recording properly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Device Manager warning on sound drivers. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Audio Driver & Device Manager Problems.
cause: Driver corruption, missing driver, or driver conflicts after update.
step_1: Open Device Manager, uninstall the audio driver and restart to let Windows reinstall it.
step_2: Download the latest audio driver from OEM website and install as administrator.
step_3: If update caused issues, roll back driver in Device Manager to previous version.
step_4: Check Event Viewer for driver-related errors and address specific error codes.
step_5: Use OEM audio utilities to run diagnostics or firmware updates for USB sound devices.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Device Manager warning on sound drivers - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Audio driver missing — microphone not recording properly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Audio driver missing. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Audio Driver & Device Manager Problems.
cause: Driver corruption, missing driver, or driver conflicts after update.
step_1: Open Device Manager, uninstall the audio driver and restart to let Windows reinstall it.
step_2: Download the latest audio driver from OEM website and install as administrator.
step_3: If update caused issues, roll back driver in Device Manager to previous version.
step_4: Check Event Viewer for driver-related errors and address specific error codes.
step_5: Use OEM audio utilities to run diagnostics or firmware updates for USB sound devices.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Audio driver missing - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: After update no sound — microphone not recording properly.
symptoms: Symptoms: After update no sound. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: OS Services & System Audio Failures.
cause: Windows audio services stopped, system file corruption, or interrupted updates.
step_1: Open Services.msc and ensure Windows Audio and Windows Audio Endpoint Builder services are running.
step_2: Run `sfc /scannow` and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to repair system files.
step_3: Uninstall recent audio-related Windows updates if audio broke after update.
step_4: Create a new Windows user account to rule out profile corruption affecting audio.
step_5: If unresolved, backup data and perform a system repair or in-place upgrade.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: After update no sound - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

error_name: Headphones plugged in but no sound
user_error_text: My PC shows 'Headphones plugged in but no sound' and I can't hear anything.
symptoms: Symptoms: Headphones plugged in but no sound. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Audio Output Not Working.
cause: Missing or disabled audio device, corrupted driver, or faulty hardware.
step_1: Check the speaker icon in the taskbar; ensure not muted and correct output is selected.
step_2: Open Device Manager → Sound, video and game controllers → scan for hardware changes.
step_3: Uninstall and reinstall audio driver; restart PC to let Windows re-detect devices.
step_4: Try alternative output (headphones/external speakers) to isolate hardware.
step_5: Run Windows Playing Audio troubleshooter (Settings → Troubleshoot → Playing Audio).
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Headphones plugged in but no sound - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: I have the issue: Audio cuts out randomly — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: Audio cuts out randomly. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Audio Output Not Working.
cause: Missing or disabled audio device, corrupted driver, or faulty hardware.
step_1: Check the speaker icon in the taskbar; ensure not muted and correct output is selected.
step_2: Open Device Manager → Sound, video and game controllers → scan for hardware changes.
step_3: Uninstall and reinstall audio driver; restart PC to let Windows re-detect devices.
step_4: Try alternative output (headphones/external speakers) to isolate hardware.
step_5: Run Windows Playing Audio troubleshooter (Settings → Troubleshoot → Playing Audio).
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Audio cuts out randomly - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Problem: Loose audio cable when using apps or calls.
symptoms: Symptoms: Loose audio cable. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Hardware / Port Issues.
cause: Physical jack/cable damage, faulty microphone or speaker hardware.
step_1: Inspect headphone jack and cables for damage; try another cable.
step_2: Test speakers/headset on another device to verify hardware works.
step_3: For USB devices, try different USB ports and reinstall the device driver.
step_4: If connector is loose, clean port and reseat connector; consider repair if physically damaged.
step_5: Replace faulty hardware if tests confirm physical failure.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Loose audio cable - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

cause: Missing or disabled audio device, corrupted driver, or faulty hardware.
step_1: Check the speaker icon in the taskbar; ensure not muted and correct output is selected.

error_name: Bluetooth headphones connected but no sound
user_error_text: My PC shows 'Bluetooth headphones connected but no sound' and I can't hear anything.
symptoms: Symptoms: Bluetooth headphones connected but no sound. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Bluetooth Audio Problems.
cause: Bluetooth pairing issues, codec mismatch, or low battery in headset.
step_1: Ensure Bluetooth headset is paired and set as default audio device.
step_2: Remove/forget the device and pair it again; check battery level on headset.
step_3: Update Bluetooth drivers and ensure Bluetooth service is running.
step_4: Switch codec settings if available (AAC/aptX) or use SBC as fallback.
step_5: Test headset on another device to confirm it's not a headset issue.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Bluetooth headphones connected but no sound - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Wrong playback device — microphone not recording properly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Wrong playback device. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Sound Settings & Configuration Errors.
cause: Incorrect device selection, muted channels, sample rate mismatch, or audio enhancements conflict.
step_1: Open Sound Settings and select the correct playback/recording device.
step_2: Set sample rate and bit depth to a supported value (e.g., 44.1kHz or 48kHz).
step_3: Disable audio enhancements that may cause distortion.
step_4: Run Sound troubleshooter and reset sound settings if necessary.
step_5: Ensure system volume and app volumes are not muted or very low.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Wrong playback device - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: I have the issue: Mic not working — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: Mic not working. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Microphone Input Errors.
cause: Microphone disabled, wrong input selected, driver or app permission issue.
step_1: Ensure microphone is unmuted and selected as default input in Sound Settings.
step_2: Check app permissions: Settings → Privacy → Microphone → allow apps to use microphone.
step_3: Test mic in Voice Recorder; if not detected, reinstall mic drivers.
step_4: Try different USB port or headset on another PC to rule out hardware.
step_5: Adjust mic levels and disable enhancements in Device Properties → Levels/Enhancements.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Mic not working - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

step_4: If connector is loose, clean port and reseat connector; consider repair if physically damaged.
step_5: Replace faulty hardware if tests confirm physical failure.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Worn-out speakers - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

error_name: Device Manager warning on sound drivers
user_error_text: After update I see: Device Manager warning on sound drivers. No sound plays.
symptoms: Symptoms: Device Manager warning on sound drivers. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Audio Driver & Device Manager Problems.
cause: Driver corruption, missing driver, or driver conflicts after update.
step_1: Open Device Manager, uninstall the audio driver and restart to let Windows reinstall it.
step_2: Download the latest audio driver from OEM website and install as administrator.
step_3: If update caused issues, roll back driver in Device Manager to previous version.
step_4: Check Event Viewer for driver-related errors and address specific error codes.
step_5: Use OEM audio utilities to run diagnostics or firmware updates for USB sound devices.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Device Manager warning on sound drivers - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: After update I see: Wrong playback device. No sound plays.
symptoms: Symptoms: Wrong playback device. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Sound Settings & Configuration Errors.
cause: Incorrect device selection, muted channels, sample rate mismatch, or audio enhancements conflict.
step_1: Open Sound Settings and select the correct playback/recording device.
step_2: Set sample rate and bit depth to a supported value (e.g., 44.1kHz or 48kHz).
step_3: Disable audio enhancements that may cause distortion.
step_4: Run Sound troubleshooter and reset sound settings if necessary.
step_5: Ensure system volume and app volumes are not muted or very low.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Wrong playback device - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: After update I see: Audio cuts out randomly. No sound plays.
symptoms: Symptoms: Audio cuts out randomly. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Audio Output Not Working.
cause: Missing or disabled audio device, corrupted driver, or faulty hardware.
step_1: Check the speaker icon in the taskbar; ensure not muted and correct output is selected.
step_2: Open Device Manager → Sound, video and game controllers → scan for hardware changes.
step_3: Uninstall and reinstall audio driver; restart PC to let Windows re-detect devices.
step_4: Try alternative output (headphones/external speakers) to isolate hardware.
step_5: Run Windows Playing Audio troubleshooter (Settings → Troubleshoot → Playing Audio).
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Audio cuts out randomly - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: After update I see: Wrong output device selected. No sound plays.
symptoms: Symptoms: Wrong output device selected. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: App & Software Audio Issues.
cause: App-specific settings, wrong device selection, or exclusive mode causing routing issues.
step_1: Open the app's audio settings and ensure correct output/input device is selected.
step_2: Check Windows Volume Mixer to ensure the app is not muted or set to low volume.
step_3: Disable exclusive mode in Device Properties → Advanced to allow multiple apps to use audio.
step_4: Restart the app and test with another application to determine if app-specific.
step_5: Reinstall the app if settings are corrupted or reset app preferences.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Wrong output device selected - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Corrupted audio system files — microphone not recording properly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Corrupted audio system files. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: OS Services & System Audio Failures.
cause: Windows audio services stopped, system file corruption, or interrupted updates.
step_1: Open Services.msc and ensure Windows Audio and Windows Audio Endpoint Builder services are running.
step_2: Run `sfc /scannow` and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to repair system files.
step_3: Uninstall recent audio-related Windows updates if audio broke after update.
step_4: Create a new Windows user account to rule out profile corruption affecting audio.
step_5: If unresolved, backup data and perform a system repair or in-place upgrade.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Corrupted audio system files - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Bluetooth mic not working — microphone not recording properly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Bluetooth mic not working. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Bluetooth Audio Problems.
cause: Bluetooth pairing issues, codec mismatch, or low battery in headset.
step_1: Ensure Bluetooth headset is paired and set as default audio device.
step_2: Remove/forget the device and pair it again; check battery level on headset.
step_3: Update Bluetooth drivers and ensure Bluetooth service is running.
step_4: Switch codec settings if available (AAC/aptX) or use SBC as fallback.
step_5: Test headset on another device to confirm it's not a headset issue.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Bluetooth mic not working - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Problem: Browser audio not working when using apps or calls.
symptoms: Symptoms: Browser audio not working. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: App & Software Audio Issues.
cause: App-specific settings, wrong device selection, or exclusive mode causing routing issues.
step_1: Open the app's audio settings and ensure correct output/input device is selected.
step_2: Check Windows Volume Mixer to ensure the app is not muted or set to low volume.
step_3: Disable exclusive mode in Device Properties → Advanced to allow multiple apps to use audio.
step_4: Restart the app and test with another application to determine if app-specific.
step_5: Reinstall the app if settings are corrupted or reset app preferences.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Browser audio not working - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Audio service not responding' and I can't hear anything.
symptoms: Symptoms: Audio service not responding. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: OS Services & System Audio Failures.
cause: Windows audio services stopped, system file corruption, or interrupted updates.
step_1: Open Services.msc and ensure Windows Audio and Windows Audio Endpoint Builder services are running.
step_2: Run `sfc /scannow` and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to repair system files.
step_3: Uninstall recent audio-related Windows updates if audio broke after update.
step_4: Create a new Windows user account to rule out profile corruption affecting audio.
step_5: If unresolved, backup data and perform a system repair or in-place upgrade.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Audio service not responding - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

error_name: No Audio Output Device is installed
user_error_text: I have the issue: No Audio Output Device is installed — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: No Audio Output Device is installed. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Audio Output Not Working.
cause: Missing or disabled audio device, corrupted driver, or faulty hardware.
step_1: Check the speaker icon in the taskbar; ensure not muted and correct output is selected.
step_2: Open Device Manager → Sound, video and game controllers → scan for hardware changes.
step_3: Uninstall and reinstall audio driver; restart PC to let Windows re-detect devices.
step_4: Try alternative output (headphones/external speakers) to isolate hardware.
step_5: Run Windows Playing Audio troubleshooter (Settings → Troubleshoot → Playing Audio).
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: No Audio Output Device is installed - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'No audio output' and I can't hear anything.
symptoms: Symptoms: No audio output. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Audio Output Not Working.
cause: Missing or disabled audio device, corrupted driver, or faulty hardware.
step_1: Check the speaker icon in the taskbar; ensure not muted and correct output is selected.

user_error_text: Problem: Audio driver missing when using apps or calls.
symptoms: Symptoms: Audio driver missing. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Audio Driver & Device Manager Problems.
cause: Driver corruption, missing driver, or driver conflicts after update.
step_1: Open Device Manager, uninstall the audio driver and restart to let Windows reinstall it.
step_2: Download the latest audio driver from OEM website and install as administrator.
step_3: If update caused issues, roll back driver in Device Manager to previous version.
step_4: Check Event Viewer for driver-related errors and address specific error codes.
step_5: Use OEM audio utilities to run diagnostics or firmware updates for USB sound devices.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Audio driver missing - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Problem: USB audio device not detected when using apps or calls.
symptoms: Symptoms: USB audio device not detected. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Hardware / Port Issues.
cause: Physical jack/cable damage, faulty microphone or speaker hardware.
step_1: Inspect headphone jack and cables for damage; try another cable.
step_2: Test speakers/headset on another device to verify hardware works.
step_3: For USB devices, try different USB ports and reinstall the device driver.
step_4: If connector is loose, clean port and reseat connector; consider repair if physically damaged.
step_5: Replace faulty hardware if tests confirm physical failure.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: USB audio device not detected - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Audio enhancements causing distortion' and I can't hear anything.
symptoms: Symptoms: Audio enhancements causing distortion. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Sound Settings & Configuration Errors.
cause: Incorrect device selection, muted channels, sample rate mismatch, or audio enhancements conflict.
step_1: Open Sound Settings and select the correct playback/recording device.
step_2: Set sample rate and bit depth to a supported value (e.g., 44.1kHz or 48kHz).
step_3: Disable audio enhancements that may cause distortion.
step_4: Run Sound troubleshooter and reset sound settings if necessary.
step_5: Ensure system volume and app volumes are not muted or very low.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Audio enhancements causing distortion - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: After update I see: Frequent disconnections. No sound plays.
symptoms: Symptoms: Frequent disconnections. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Bluetooth Audio Problems.
cause: Bluetooth pairing issues, codec mismatch, or low battery in headset.
step_1: Ensure Bluetooth headset is paired and set as default audio device.
step_2: Remove/forget the device and pair it again; check battery level on headset.
step_3: Update Bluetooth drivers and ensure Bluetooth service is running.
step_4: Switch codec settings if available (AAC/aptX) or use SBC as fallback.
step_5: Test headset on another device to confirm it's not a headset issue.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Frequent disconnections - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

error_name: Mic works in one app but not another
user_error_text: Problem: Mic works in one app but not another when using apps or calls.
symptoms: Symptoms: Mic works in one app but not another. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Microphone Input Errors.
cause: Microphone disabled, wrong input selected, driver or app permission issue.
step_1: Ensure microphone is unmuted and selected as default input in Sound Settings.
step_2: Check app permissions: Settings → Privacy → Microphone → allow apps to use microphone.
step_3: Test mic in Voice Recorder; if not detected, reinstall mic drivers.
step_4: Try different USB port or headset on another PC to rule out hardware.
step_5: Adjust mic levels and disable enhancements in Device Properties → Levels/Enhancements.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Mic works in one app but not another - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

step_4: Switch codec settings if available (AAC/aptX) or use SBC as fallback.
step_5: Test headset on another device to confirm it's not a headset issue.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Bluetooth mic not working - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

error_name: Mic works in one app but not another
user_error_text: My PC shows 'Mic works in one app but not another' and I can't hear anything.
symptoms: Symptoms: Mic works in one app but not another. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Microphone Input Errors.
cause: Microphone disabled, wrong input selected, driver or app permission issue.
step_1: Ensure microphone is unmuted and selected as default input in Sound Settings.
step_2: Check app permissions: Settings → Privacy → Microphone → allow apps to use microphone.
step_3: Test mic in Voice Recorder; if not detected, reinstall mic drivers.
step_4: Try different USB port or headset on another PC to rule out hardware.
step_5: Adjust mic levels and disable enhancements in Device Properties → Levels/Enhancements.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Mic works in one app but not another - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: I have the issue: Background noise or static — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: Background noise or static. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Microphone Input Errors.
cause: Microphone disabled, wrong input selected, driver or app permission issue.
step_1: Ensure microphone is unmuted and selected as default input in Sound Settings.
step_2: Check app permissions: Settings → Privacy → Microphone → allow apps to use microphone.
step_3: Test mic in Voice Recorder; if not detected, reinstall mic drivers.
step_4: Try different USB port or headset on another PC to rule out hardware.
step_5: Adjust mic levels and disable enhancements in Device Properties → Levels/Enhancements.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Background noise or static - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: After update no sound — microphone not recording properly.
symptoms: Symptoms: After update no sound. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: OS Services & System Audio Failures.
cause: Windows audio services stopped, system file corruption, or interrupted updates.
step_1: Open Services.msc and ensure Windows Audio and Windows Audio Endpoint Builder services are running.
step_2: Run `sfc /scannow` and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to repair system files.
step_3: Uninstall recent audio-related Windows updates if audio broke after update.
step_4: Create a new Windows user account to rule out profile corruption affecting audio.
step_5: If unresolved, backup data and perform a system repair or in-place upgrade.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: After update no sound - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: I have the issue: Spatial Sound issues — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: Spatial Sound issues. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Sound Settings & Configuration Errors.
cause: Incorrect device selection, muted channels, sample rate mismatch, or audio enhancements conflict.
step_1: Open Sound Settings and select the correct playback/recording device.
step_2: Set sample rate and bit depth to a supported value (e.g., 44.1kHz or 48kHz).
step_3: Disable audio enhancements that may cause distortion.
step_4: Run Sound troubleshooter and reset sound settings if necessary.
step_5: Ensure system volume and app volumes are not muted or very low.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Spatial Sound issues - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: After update I see: Broken headphone jack. No sound plays.
symptoms: Symptoms: Broken headphone jack. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Hardware / Port Issues.
cause: Physical jack/cable damage, faulty microphone or speaker hardware.
step_1: Inspect headphone jack and cables for damage; try another cable.
step_2: Test speakers/headset on another device to verify hardware works.
step_3: For USB devices, try different USB ports and reinstall the device driver.
step_4: If connector is loose, clean port and reseat connector; consider repair if physically damaged.
step_5: Replace faulty hardware if tests confirm physical failure.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Broken headphone jack - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Problem: Bluetooth mic not working when using apps or calls.
symptoms: Symptoms: Bluetooth mic not working. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Bluetooth Audio Problems.
cause: Bluetooth pairing issues, codec mismatch, or low battery in headset.
step_1: Ensure Bluetooth headset is paired and set as default audio device.
step_2: Remove/forget the device and pair it again; check battery level on headset.
step_3: Update Bluetooth drivers and ensure Bluetooth service is running.
step_4: Switch codec settings if available (AAC/aptX) or use SBC as fallback.
step_5: Test headset on another device to confirm it's not a headset issue.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Bluetooth mic not working - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Problem: Audio cuts out randomly when using apps or calls.
symptoms: Symptoms: Audio cuts out randomly. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: Audio Output Not Working.
cause: Missing or disabled audio device, corrupted driver, or faulty hardware.
step_1: Check the speaker icon in the taskbar; ensure not muted and correct output is selected.
step_2: Open Device Manager → Sound, video and game controllers → scan for hardware changes.
step_3: Uninstall and reinstall audio driver; restart PC to let Windows re-detect devices.
step_4: Try alternative output (headphones/external speakers) to isolate hardware.
step_5: Run Windows Playing Audio troubleshooter (Settings → Troubleshoot → Playing Audio).
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Audio cuts out randomly - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

user_error_text: After update I see: Exclusive mode blocking audio. No sound plays.
symptoms: Symptoms: Exclusive mode blocking audio. Sound missing, distorted, or devices not detected. Category: App & Software Audio Issues.
cause: App-specific settings, wrong device selection, or exclusive mode causing routing issues.
step_1: Open the app's audio settings and ensure correct output/input device is selected.
step_2: Check Windows Volume Mixer to ensure the app is not muted or set to low volume.
step_3: Disable exclusive mode in Device Properties → Advanced to allow multiple apps to use audio.
step_4: Restart the app and test with another application to determine if app-specific.
step_5: Reinstall the app if settings are corrupted or reset app preferences.
verification: Audio functions correctly and devices are detected; no more audio errors.
log_snippet: Exclusive mode blocking audio - Audio system event logged in Event Viewer.

cause: Driver corruption, missing driver, or driver conflicts after update.
